item.title: Implementing a Simple Stack in Java
item.description:
Implementing a Simple Stack in Java

Introduction

Today, we’re going to implement a simple Stack data structure in Java. A stack is a fundamental data structure that follows the Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) principle. Think of it like a stack of plates â€“ you always take the top plate off first. We’ll create a stack that can store integers and includes basic operations like push, pop, peek, and isEmpty.

Explanation

Implementing a stack might seem straightforward, but it presents a few challenges:
